snippet: Jamil Hasanli, who appeared headed to defeat in Azerbaijan’s presidential election, said a compressed campaign calendar was one obstacle in his attempt to deny Ilham Aliyev a third term.
abstract: Jamil Hasanli, who appears headed for defeat in Azerbaijan’s presidential election, says his bid to deny Ilham Aliyev a third term was hampered by a rushed campaign calendar, lack of money and exposure in state-controlled news media, and indifference of the rest of the world.
lead_paragraph: Jamil Hasanli, who appeared headed to defeat in Azerbaijan’s presidential election, said a compressed campaign calendar was one obstacle in his attempt to deny Ilham Aliyev a third term.

headline.main: Fairness an Issue, Even After Azerbaijan Votes
headline.print_headline: Fairness an Issue, Even After Azerbaijan Votes
